title: Bitcoin Back Over $51K, Crypto Market Recovers as Nvidia Earnings Rejuvenates AI-Tokens
description: The haphazard price action caused over $200 million in liquidations of crypto-tracked futures, of which $150 million were longs, or bets, against higher prices.

title: Texas Bitcoin mining firm sues SEC for overreach on crypto
description: A Texas crypto firm and industry group sued the SEC, disputing its authority over exchange-traded crypto, aiming to classify them as non-securities. In a legal maneuver against the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), a Texas-based crypto mining firm called…

title: Coinbase calls on SEC to approve Grayscale’s spot Ethereum ETF
description: The Coinbase team has called on the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to approve Grayscale’s application to launch a spot Ethereum (ETH) ETF. The company’s chief lawyer, Paul Grewal, believes that approval of Grayscale’s application is necessary through the…

title: Solana loses over 12% in a week as active addresses decline
description: Solana saw a double-digit decline this week despite its competitors BNB and Ethereum experiencing gains of over 11% and 5%, respectively.  Solana and Avalanche stand out as the only two altcoins among the top 15 cryptocurrencies to suffer over 12%…

title: Vitalik Buterin Not a Fan of Simplifying L1s at the Expense of L2s
description:
Vitalik Buterin, the co-founder of the blockchain network Ethereum, has stated that he is not confident in the concept of simplifying “L1 even at the expense of more complicated L2s” because it is currently not clear if L2 blockchain networks are better than L1s. In a post on social media platform X (formerly known as […]

The post Vitalik Buterin Not a Fan of Simplifying L1s at the Expense of L2s appeared first on Coin Edition.
